title: How could I prove I can hear ultrasonic waves and decipher them? - Quora

response.answer_text: The tricky part is going to be coming up with a source for those ultrasonic sounds, which you know is generating the frequencies of interest and radiating them as sound. This will take some instrumentation and careful measurements to determine the frequencies and their amplitudes. Make certain that the gear is not accidentally emitting anything within the “normal” range of audible frequencies which could lead to false results. Once you are sure you have such a system and it is working properly, just put the generator, a silent switch, an operator, and some witnesses in one room, and the sonic radiator and yourself in another where you cannot see them or hear what they are doing. Then just have the operator press the switch — or not — and you respond whether you can hear anything — or not. Perform enough trials to minimize any error caused by guessing. Not sure what you mean by “decipher them”, though. Do you mean that if the device were used to send Morse code you could understand what was sent? Or that somehow a “voice” is translated to ultrasonic frequencies and that you can comprehend it? That would be considerably more difficult, as some very specialized equipment would have to be designed and tested.

Easy. Get an ultrasonic unit (medical or industrial, it doesn’t matter), ensure a transducer is actively emitting sound waves above 20,000 kHz then if you can truly hear the signal, explain what they mean. Of course this is absolutely impossible even if by some miracle you could hear the UT because those signals are used to propagate through a medium. The ONLY “deciphering” going on is when return signals are used for diagnostic purposes; other than that, the signals have NO meaning.
